Accountant Job at Odixcity Consulting




        
    

        
        Odixcity Consulting is an International Hr consulting and procurement firm. With expertise in Recruitment & Selection, Performance management, Training & Development, Compensation and benefits as well as Outsourcing of goods and services for organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are in need of an accountant that will be responsible for preparing, examining and analyzing financial records.
	A person that can provide the insights into financial performance, assist with tax preparation, payee & Vat and also pay attention to details, analytical skills and knowledge of accounting principles that are essential to ensure financial integrity and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of income, expenses, assets and liabilities.
	Calculate tax, filing returns and advising on tax- saving strategies.
	Interpret financial data to support business decisions.
	Monitor the cash inflows and outflows to ensure Liquidity.
	Process salaries deductions and benefits.
	Work with multiple clients on auditing tax and consulting.
	Support Internal and external audits.


Requirements


	A Degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field.
	Proven experience with 3 years or more experience in accounting.
	Knowledge of Accounting software.
	Must have a strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Resilient, self-motivated, and target-driven.
	Ability to work Independently.


Salary
N350,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: odixcityconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Human Resources Team Lead / Supervisor Job at Coleman Technical Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Coleman Technical Industries Limited, the manufacturer of the reputable Coleman Wires and Cables, is Sub-the Saharan Africa’s largest cable manufacturer, renowned for quality, reliability, and innovation. From its ultra-modern manufacturing facilities in Arepo and Sagamu, including its recently commissioned state-of-the-art plant, producing the best fibre-optic cables with FRP in Africa, the company remains committed to industrial excellence, safety, and national development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Team Lead / Supervisor

Job Location: Arepo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Human Resources Team Lead / Supervisor will provide operational and strategic HR leadership, ensuring effective implementation of HR policies, procedures, and best practices.
	The role is responsible for supervising HR operations, supporting management on people-related matters, and ensuring compliance with labor laws while fostering a positive and productive work environment.


Job Description


	The Human Resources Team Lead / Supervisor will oversee day-to-day HR activities including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, payroll coordination, and staff welfare.
	The role requires a proactive professional capable of guiding HR officers, supporting organizational objectives, and maintaining accurate HR records.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate daily HR operations and activities.
	Implement and enforce HR policies, procedures, and company regulations.
	Manage end-to-end recruitment and selection processes.
	Support onboarding, confirmation, promotion, and exit processes.
	Handle employee relations issues, grievances, and disciplinary processes in line with policy.
	Coordinate performance management and appraisal processes.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, statutory regulations, and internal controls.
	Support payroll processing by validating employee data and changes.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR reports.
	Provide HR advisory support to line managers and employees.
	Assist in training, learning, and development initiatives.


Educational Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or a related discipline.
	A professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, HRCI) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 5–6 years of relevant human resources experience.
	At least 2 years in a supervisory or team lead HR role is preferred.


Required Skills and Competencies:


	Proficiency in HR systems, payroll tools, and Microsoft Office applications.
	Strong knowledge of human resources principles, labor laws, and HR best practices.
	Excellent leadership and people management skills.
	Strong communication, interpersonal, and conflict-resolution abilities.
	High level of confidentiality, integrity, and professionalism.
	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Residing within or close to Arepo is an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@colemancables.com using “HR Team lead/Supervisor– Arepo” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
